publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by Ruth Raworth and Susan Islip] for Humphrey Moseley, and are to be sold at his shop at the signe of the Princes Armes in St. Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Includes: Narcissus and The triumph of beautie, each of which have separate title pages, separate pagination and registers. The triumph of beautie was apparently also issued separately.
"It is apparent that sheet D of the second part, pp. 147-[162], is a late insertion. It is not called for by the catchword, verso [C8]"--Pforzheimer catalogue.
Page 28 of the final sequence is misnumbered 30.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
